title: Tesla making 2,000 Model 3s per week: report
text:
(Reuters) - Tesla Inc ( TSLA.O ) will fall short of its 2,500 per week target for production of the crucial Model 3 sedan when it reports its numbers this week, according to a report by tech website Jalopnik, citing an email from Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk to employees.
A Tesla Model 3 sedan, its first car aimed at the mass market, is displayed during its launch in Hawthorne, California, U.S. March 31, 2016. REUTERS/Joe White - Musk told employees in a company-wide email on Monday that Tesla had just passed a rate of 2,000 per week, the report said. That was still a big increase from earlier production numbers and Tesla shares recovered some of Mondayâ€™s heavy losses in reaction to the report.
The company did not immediately respond to requests for comment.
Reporting by Sonam Rai and Patrick Graham; Editing by Bernard Orr
